title: Soba Noodles with Eggplant and Mango Recipe
directions: In a small pot combine rice vinegar, sugar, salt, garlic, and chilli. Bring to a simmer and whisk until salt and sugar are dissolved. Remove from heat.
Once cooled, add sesame oil and the zest and juice of the lime.
Add chopped red onion to mixture and set aside.
In a large pan over medium-high heat and a couple tablespoons of oil.

Place eggplant flesh side down and cook until it is golden brown (about five minutes). Flip eggplant over to the skin side and cook until golden brown (about five minutes). Depending on the size of your pan, this may require a couple of batches.
Remove eggplant from pan and drain on paper towel.
Chop eggplant into bite sized pieces
Cook soba noodles until just cooked through. Drain in colander and rinse under cold water.
In a large pot, gently toss soba noodles, sauce, eggplant, mango and cilantro.
Heat up or serve at room temperature.
ingredients: Zest from 1 lime (about 1 tablespoon), finely grated
3 japanese eggplants, cut in half and lengthwise and season with salt and pepper
